docs.snippet: Commissioner Bud Selig and Yankees shortstop Derek Jeter entered the league in the same year, and as they prepare to ride off into the sunset of retirement, their respect for what each brought to the game is evident....
docs.lead_paragraph: Commissioner Bud Selig and Yankees shortstop Derek Jeter entered the league in the same year, and as they prepare to ride off into the sunset of retirement, their respect for what each brought to the game is evident.
docs.abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column column observes retirement of both Derek Jeter and former Major League Baseball Commissioner Bud Selig from the sport; says men, who both entered league in 1992, both brought significant improvements to game during their tenures.

headline.seo: Derek Jeter and Bud Selig, in Matching Tenures, Made M.L.B. Better
headline.main: Leaving a Sport in Better Shape
headline.print_headline: Leaving a Sport in Better Shape

headline.main: Selig Hopes to Award Two Future Games Before His Retirement

docs.snippet: Derek Jeter led off the All-Star Game with a double that sparked a three-run inning as the American League topped the National League and gained home-field advantage for the World Series....
docs.lead_paragraph: Derek Jeter led off the All-Star Game with a double that sparked a three-run inning as the American League topped the National League and gained home-field advantage for the World Series.
docs.abstract: American League defeats National League, 5-3, in All-Star Game; pitcher Adam Wainright favors Derek Jeter, playing 14th and final All-Star game of his career, allowing him to finish his All-Star career with .481 average.

headline.seo: M.L.B. All-Star Game 2014: Derek Jeter Nabs 2 Hits in A.L. Victory
headline.main: Jeter Takes Advantage, and So Does the American League
headline.print_headline: Jeter Takes Advantage, and So Does the American League

docs.snippet: Almost two years after losing his firstborn to an illness, pitcher Pat Neshek, 33, won a roster spot with St. Louis, became a father again and, finally, a first-time All-Star....
docs.lead_paragraph: Almost two years after losing his firstborn to an illness, pitcher Pat Neshek, 33, won a roster spot with St. Louis, became a father again and, finally, a first-time All-Star.
docs.abstract: St Louis Cardinals relief pitcher Pat Neshek has, nearly two years after losing his firstborn son to unexplained illness, won roster spot with St Louis and become father again, as well as first time All-Star.

headline.seo: Cardinals Marvel at Pat Neshek’s Comeback
headline.main: Cardinal Reliever’s Tumultuous Road Leads to an All-Star Ending
headline.print_headline: Cardinal Reliever’s Tumultuous Road Leads to an All-Star Ending
